website_summaries.verdict: A fine model for tackling humidity and mold growth in tiny spaces such as bathrooms, closets, and boats, this small dehumidifier is a simple, inexpensive, and reliable solution for common household moisture issues.
pros: Collects up to 20 ounces of water in a day
Covers areas up to 2,200 cubic feet
cons: Dehumidifiers this size won’t do much for medium-sized or larger spaces

customer_reviews.title: Expect to buy another one in a year
customer_reviews.text: Expect it to die shortly after the 1 year warranty expires. I have purchased this one and a sister model through Walmart IVAGDM36 and do not recommend them unless you like dealing with warranty issues and shopping for a new item in a year or so. My IVAGDM36 died in 14 months so just out of warranty. It just would not turn back on. It worked fine until then, but not worth it for a 14 month life span. I contacted the company and while polite couldn't offer me anything other than a "sorry". Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be working fine but in our case I may not need it
customer_reviews.text: It appears to be working fine but in our case I may not need it. It hasn't pulled any water from the bedroom it's in however the house humidity is only 40%. My mother who has COPD thought the humidity in the house was making her breathing worse and it turns out that it hasn't. Will probably send it back but the best thing about it is that's it's super quiet. It needs room on 3 sides because it pulls in air from the front and exhausts it out the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A Hausenflock

customer_reviews.title: it worked great until it stopped working this week
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Dehumidifier in Early May 2015, it worked great until it stopped working this week, August 15, 2015. Purchasing at almost 100.00 I would expect this product to last more than a little over two months. I have not moved it any and have only emptied the water when the indicator light was on. there is a "clicking" noise when attempting to turn it on and it simply will not turn on. I will not purchase this product again, as the return date was up in June, It must be cheaply made I am disappointed, and wasted my money for the small amount of time this product did work the two months that it did work.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShop

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a nearly 1,700 cubic foot space that I need to dehumidify by about 10-15%. I know that the maximum space any device says it can dehumidify is always a bit of a stretch so I figured I would need two of these. I only bought one because I found that it is so slow to dehumidify that it wouldn't do the job at all. It does "work" but it pulls the water out of the air so slowly that it really has no impact on the humidity level. This is probably only good for dehumidifying a small closet in a home that already has low humidity levels.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Only good for about a year.  I've had 3.
customer_reviews.text: I have had 3 of these. The last one lasted about 10 months and now will not turn on. Another lasted about a year and then did not seem to be working well. I took the back off and half the unit was black from overheating (I work on electronics for a living) and was barely collecting water. The 3rd is still going, so I guess if you want to buy one every year it is a good product. If you expect more than buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Shain

customer_reviews.title: Real Review: Great for its size dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little dehumidifier. Not big enough for my entire basement, which is 800 sq ft finished, but outstanding for about half of that. I am emptying it about every 5 days and the humid smell is nearly gone. It is SO easy to set up and use. I would highly recommend. I looked at a lot of dehumidifiers before buying this one and the other ones all look to have fake reviews. Many of the reviews were written the same day and sound the same. Few, if any, verified purchases. They may be fine, but I don't trust them. I've had this one several weeks and have been very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Reader

customer_reviews.title: Does not last!
customer_reviews.text: I had an old GE dehumidifier growing up. It's still working in my parent's basement. The Ivation worked well enough to keep the humidity down in a small office, but it died 20 months into service. I took it apart and one of the circuit board components was fried. Other than that, no corrosion. So it's probably a cheap part from the company. At $80 that works out to $4.00 a month. I'm sure that old GE is pennies a month. And that's what I'll be going with in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McCaffery

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my small camper trailer. Constant over a 4 day weekend at the beach. It only pulled about half a container over the entire weekend. With the AC running nonstop and this thing, it was still extremity muggy. We only went in the camper at night to sleep, the rest of the time was spent in the waves. Don't waste your money or time. Get a better unit for another $100 or so. Worthless item, even the TP, kleenex and paper towels were damp.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine for those who need it.
customer_reviews.text: I had this model in my apartment running near constantly for 2 years. It broke about a month before I moved. It did its job and dutifully removed a complete container of moisture from the air in my living room every other day. I’m not sure why it broke, but after I got back from a week long vacation it failed to turn on again. I would certainly purchase this product again for cases when I needed to remove moisture from the air in a small-medium sized space.m The noise never bothered me.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: For little spaces only
customer_reviews.text: It works as well as can be expected, but only useful for a really small area that you dont want to spring for a traditional dehumidifier. It does remove moisture, but small amount. About 12 ounces in an 12×16 outdoor insulated she shed in a period of 36 hours. Air felt a little less humid. A traditional small dehumidifier would remove about 3/4 of a gallon and noticeably reduce humidity level. I think this would work best for a medium closet. Dont know how much energy it would save.
customer_reviews.author: john w. roan

customer_reviews.title: this little guy is great. we live in a single wide mobile home ...
customer_reviews.text: this little guy is great. we live in a single wide mobile home and have had a terrible time with mold. we bought one of these last year and set up in a bedroom. we have not had any trouble with mold in that room since. so we recently bought 2 more of these and have them set up in the other 2 bedrooms. we pull a bucket of water out of all 3 of them combined twice a week.. they work fantastic. we are hoping no more mold grows in this place from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth V. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Item was dead on arrival. The power supply has an LED that lights up on it when I plug it into a socket, but I still tried multiple sockets to be sure. The item would not power on. I also ordered the smaller GDM20 model along with this one, and the smaller one has some issues as well, so I didn't bother ordering a new one to see if I just got unlucky. Amazon customer service was awesome in refunding my money with this, of course.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - DANGEROUS!,
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these units I purchased and have had the same overheating problem with both. Where the plug goes into the unit overheats and melts the plug and back of the unit. See pictures. The plug is so hot that you will burn your fingers
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: This actually works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for traveling and it fits nicely in my suitcase. We go to the tropics a lot and it is soo humid that we need this for camping. We run this on a suoaki portable generator. Which is not ideal because it does take more power than the suoaki holds. But, for the few hours that we have it running, it took quite a bit of water out of the air
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great dehumidifier. Plug it in and it works, and quietly! Only criticism is that the water well needs to come apart easier for cleaning. It really needs to be able to be run through a dishwasher or something occasionally for cleanliness, and the top is not an easy thing to get off.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Butler

customer_reviews.title: I like to read reviews before I buy
customer_reviews.text: I live in a tropical climate and had a problem with condensation on an air conditioning vent in a 12' x 15' bathroom. If I keep the door closed, the dehumidifier keeps the vent dry. I have to empty the tank every three or four days. I like to read reviews before I buy. Some of them mentioned whisper quiet. It is quiet but not whisper quiet. Some mentioned it blows hot air. Not true, just slightly warmer than ambient, not hot. Good product. I am very happy with the purchase. Its 1 month later - still happy but just found out that the unit turns itself off when the tank is full. Another great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Ivation IVADM35 Powerful Mid-Size Thermo-Electric Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: Received it, have not used it yet. Opened the package and found out the 12 vdc adaptor is NOT included, only the 120 vac adaptor came with the machine. It does put out 13 vdc from 120 vac. I had to order an 12 vdc extension cord (12 vdc cigarette style plug to the 2 pin plug which goes into the machine for use in our RV when not on shore power or generator. Rating based on not using it yet, and the 12 vdc. not included as stated.
customer_reviews.author: John Newman

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for my small camper
customer_reviews.text: This product may work for some, but in 3 days it didn't even pull out a cup of water in my 22 ft. camper. Bought a 30 pint regular house size from a different source, it not only pulled 30 pints in 3 days...but kept the little camper warm as well. Just didn't do what we needed fast enough, but for others it would probably work well.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cat

customer_reviews.title: Condensation getting you down?
customer_reviews.text: This as recommended by a longtime travel trailer owner. It sucks out the water very well and is just the right size for a small model travel trailer. Quiet and small enough to sit on a shelf or in a small corner. Would recommend it to other travel trailer owners especially those who vacation in humid areas.
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: substandard - i wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: I have a barometer right next to the unit and the humidity does not change. Though the water tray does fill after a day or to i dont rally think it is doing anything worth the cost of the unit. i would not buy this again or recommend anyone buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Amazon was terrific about the return
customer_reviews.text: Received very promptly. Machine is simple to install and use. I find the sound too loud to sleep, but my son finds it restful so it runs 24/7 in his room. Pulls 8 - 10 oz water each day. After 3 weeks of continual use, it suddenly died. I emptied it one day and then it would not turn on again after replacing catch basin. Amazon was terrific about the return. I will order a new one and hope the defect does not repeat itself. We also have two of the IVAGDM20 (dehumiMini). One for bathroom, one for my bedroom. Both work very well and much quieter than the 35.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: *Sad Trombone*
customer_reviews.text: This is a mediocre dehumidifier at best. I put it in a small space with 80% humidity, running constantly, and it took over a week for the reservoir to fill up. It didn't actually reduce the humidity at all. It also collects ice in the internals if the temperature gets below 50 degrees. Yes, the power pack does get hot. Yes, that is quite concerning. I ended up throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Carolers Will Be Criticized

customer_reviews.title: Works very slowly & then doesn't
customer_reviews.text: It works but the rate of water accumulation is much slower than a similar size unit (different brand) I had previously. I don't know if it's my unit (I got it from Amazon warehouse) or the particular brand. Others seem to have better results with theirs. Update - bought it in Nov 2016 - died in Jan 2017. Dropped another 2 stars. The only positive is that it was very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: caczep

customer_reviews.title: but it wasn't pulling as much moisture and smell out of the room as I would have liked. This baby really does the job
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver. My walk-in closet gets really humid, as a combination of living in Louisiana, the closet butting up against the back of my neighbor's bathroom, and the fact that my cats' litter box is in there, too. I already had Damprid hanging in the closet, but it wasn't pulling as much moisture and smell out of the room as I would have liked. This baby really does the job. The humidity is gone, the smell is gone, and I only have to empty it out about once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Anna H.

customer_reviews.title: Battery heats up when plugged in.. First time ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery heats up when plugged in.. First time I plugged it in and left running for a day had got to more than 130 degrees from a thermal camera. Definitely a potential fire hazard --- no other appliances got that hot. Sending back immediately --- save the box and packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would try to cleaning them so I took a philips screw driver and exposed the fan assembly which was very easy. While I know how to use a screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding product that has worked trouble and mainetance free for years. Recently, the fan started making noise because of buildup of debris on the fan blades. I thought I would try to cleaning them so I took a philips screw driver and exposed the fan assembly which was very easy. While I know how to use a screwdriver, I don't consider myself to be highly mechanical. After cleaning the blades and putting it back together, it operates near silently as it did the day I first plugged it in. Total time required: 10 minutes. My basement will once more be excess moisture free. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jparki23

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier does just what it's suppose to do. Small in size, but big in work performed!. Works so good we bought another one. We live in a basement and everything always felt damp, but now it's a lot more comfortable. The new one will go into bathroom/bedroom area.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Working well in barn r
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this dehumidifier in my horse tack room. It works well, I empty a full container of water out of it about every 5 days. So far it is keeping the leather in the room from molding as the weather gets damper. Runs quietly. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: julie b

customer_reviews.title: Finally! No More Damp Shoes and Clothes in my Closet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little machine. We live in Florida where a lot of humidity creeps in from the bay outside our windows. An interior closet was almost impossible to keep dry and my shoes regularly grew little green gardens all on their own. This little machine went right to work. It is not at all noisy and I have not been surprised to see just how much water it pulls out of that closet! It is the perfect size for a walk-in closet plus dressing area/shower room/linen closet. I haven't tried it in a larger room, but then I didn't buy it for that. Hooray for the Ivation. Small but Mighty.
customer_reviews.author: DolphinWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Didn't collect much water
customer_reviews.text: We returned this because it wasn't collecting much water at all. We ran it all day for a couple of days and it collected about a 1/4 cup of water. It may have been in too large of a room to work properly, but once we returned it and went with a larger model by a different manufacturer, that one worked fine. This model was just too small to make a difference in our living room.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Reservoir can’t be cleaned. Company customer service is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Product works but the reservoir grew mold and had scale deposits and could not be opened to clean. In an attempt to clean the reservoir I broke it and now it doesn’t have a shut off mechanism and overflows. I wanted to order a replacement part but customer service at the company website has not responded to my inquiry. It’s unfortunate because when it works it works well- if only it could be cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Working very well in our oversized basement bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this was "heavy-duty" enough, but we could tell within the first day that it was making a difference. We are one week in, and have had to empty it twice. The unobtrusive size and quietness more than makes up for inconvenience of frequent emptying. As long as it continues to work this well, we will consider it an excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: For the children

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed 1. Looks bigger than it really is and advertised as mid size. Actually extremely small 2. Only off and on. No monitors . No automatic cutoff when desired humidity is met I put it in a small walk in closet. The humidity never decreased. Not after 36 hours. Some water was in the reservoir but not much.
customer_reviews.author: Larry W. Freudenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not very good at pulling humidity out of air
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dehumidifier because of the size and watts used.....even though it does pull humidity out of the air it takes forever to do it. I used it in my bedroom and it was having trouble keeping the humidity down below 70% so I purchased a Ecoseb dd122EA simple and it got my humidity down to 50% within a couple of hours and in my opinion the Ecoseb is quieter than the Ivation.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Giannini

customer_reviews.title: Does what is needed for small bathroom
customer_reviews.text: It took care of moisture issue in our small bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stairs

customer_reviews.title: Good little unit
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for a small room in my house that tends to gather moisture. It works very good for small spaces. I did have problems with the switch after a couple of years. At that point I just left the switch on and turned it off and on by unplugging it. It's still working many years later.
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: No way to clean tank
customer_reviews.text: I threw this out after 1 summer. Mold started growing in the tank and there was no way to clean it. The reservoir does not have a removable cap, it only has a plug. It's fairly quiet but the light on top is annoying. The cord charger got really hot and could have potentially caused a problem if plugged in 24/7. I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Beat the summer humidity! Great for our basement apt
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my small NYC basement apartment and it has been a lifesaver. They're a little loud (like a fan blowing on low speed) but they get the job done and they look nice, too. I don't want to think about a new york summer without these...
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Works well in small area
customer_reviews.text: It works great in my bathroom. The exhaust fan is broken so there is almost no ventilation. This dehumidifier keeps it from smelling like mold and mildew, and makes sure my towels are dry before the next shower!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: but with the addition of the Ivation it seems to be working fine so far
customer_reviews.text: I have had several small dehumidifiers, this one removes more moisture than the others. It is more expensive, but worth the difference. It's for a small room and can't compare to the large models. I have it in a small bathroom which also has the exhaust fan. By itself my exhaust fan didn't keep down the mold, but with the addition of the Ivation it seems to be working fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for five months, then gave up the ghost.
customer_reviews.text: This product did exactly what it said it would do for five glorious months, then went dead as a door nail. So if you're planning on using it for more than that, you'll have to buy the extended warranty. I used it in a 10' X 20' building and it brought the humidity down to around 55%. I'm in Arkansas where high humidity is a fact of life except in August when everything goes crispy and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Arkansas Woman

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Okay this unit seems to work well but only for small rooms. I have it in a room smaller than the size it says it can handle and it works. I wouldn't call it fantastic but for a small space it's good. You will also have to run it all the time. Don't expect it to quickly dehumidify a room. When I leave it run all the time it works well. Most of the time it's very quiet. Just recently the fan seems to be getting louder, I hope that isn't a problem waiting to happen. But so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Paal

customer_reviews.title: I set it up three weeks ago in a humid ...
customer_reviews.text: I set it up three weeks ago in a humid, damp garage and it has run ever since, reducing the humidity to low levels. I've since placed the IVADM35 in a collectable MBZ, I have in my garage to reduce the humidity that gathers inside the passenger compartment of the car, and it is doing a great job of keeping the humidity low.
customer_reviews.author: Penman

customer_reviews.title: Works quite well so far
customer_reviews.text: I have a 45 pint dehumidifier in my basement & use this unit as a supplement in one of the rooms. It seems to work well & I plan to use it exclusively when the outside humidity is much lower than it is now.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Beckala

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, it really just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I ran this in a 10x12x8 room that reached 56% humidity, and was leveled there for several hours. After 24 hours, there was less than a cup of water in the bin,m and the humidity remained completely unchanged. Either I got a defective one, or something is up with the reviews of this model.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Good thing I had it on the tile floor instead ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran 8 hours in my RV on a humid day, collected 2 oz of water. Power converter got so hot you could not pick it up. Good thing I had it on the tile floor instead of the countertop.This thing could hurt somebody, plastic vapors in an RV = Not Good. Had to wait 20 min to let it cool before putting it in the plastic shipping bag for return.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Phil

customer_reviews.title: 6x14 camper
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6x14 camper and it is helping reduced the humidity at night.
customer_reviews.author: J Bergh

customer_reviews.title: Faulty design
customer_reviews.text: Fan continues to pop off its reel whenever the water tank gets changed. Had this issue to a lesser degree with the smaller ones but this mid sized one has it happen continuously resulting in an annoying whirring sound everytime it happens.
customer_reviews.author: AO

customer_reviews.title: Barely effected the room
customer_reviews.text: Left in a medium size room and humidity never came down below 75%. Barely effected the room, probably because it takes 48 hours for the water container to fill. More like a very very small room dehumidifier. Weak machine, made in China. I would not suggest buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Ivation Dehumidifier that we have owned. The first one lasted us 4 years (it was on 24/7). We definitely got our monies worth. We used it in our master bedroom closet. It is amazing how quickly it fills up with water. Before we had it I would find mold on my clothes...not any more. It's a great size too. I highly recommend it:-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked ~2 Years, Then Died.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year and a half in my muggy San Francsico bedroom, then started making a very loud whirring noise whenever plugged in. Eventually just stopped working completely. While it did work, it de-humidified my large-ish bedroom. It didn't make the room dry, but it did prevent mold from growing, which was the important thing for me.
customer_reviews.author: gidget.and.iggy

customer_reviews.title: Moving parts failed
customer_reviews.text: As a dehumidifier it works ok at best. What really bothered me was that it was advertised as a product with "no moving parts to break". This is simply not true. The fan inside the unit that last I checked moves was the first thing to fail. I believe the bearings in the computer cooling fan went out and began to squeal very loudly. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Must have for RV in PNW
customer_reviews.text: If you have a smaller RV and live in the Pacific Northwest you should not be without one of these. It has donee wonders for keeping the humidity down in my RV. My brother even put it in his unused bedrooms to help dry them out. It helped dry them reducing the mold smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kip Nissen

customer_reviews.title: OMG this device is amazing. I live near the river
customer_reviews.text: OMG this device is amazing. I live near the river. My bedroom felt clammy. Damp sheet and the papers in the room were damp. My bedroom is a 10x17 with a bathroom attached. This dehumidifier dries out my room so quick and the damp towels and wash cloths in the bathroom. This does not take up a lot of space at all. Very pleased with this purchase. I am telling everyone about this.
customer_reviews.author: Black Princess

customer_reviews.title: Works fairly well - perfect for small rooms that can be enclosed
customer_reviews.text: Works fairly well - perfect for small rooms that can be enclosed. Our bedroom is unfortunately connected to a walk in closet and the sink area for our bathroom(like many hotels are), and therefore it makes it harder for this thing to draw up moisture, but it still works fairly well and is MUCH better than nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Joel

customer_reviews.title: Runs almost completely silent
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier is not going to pull a huge amount of water from the air. During the summer months, I empty my Frigidaire 50L on a daily basis. This Ivation I empty maybe once per week. However, the Ivation is small and almost completely silent. It is great to keep in my bedroom and causes no disturbances when I sleep. If you are looking for a compact, quiet dehumidifier and do not need to pull large amounts of water, this is a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Ringel

customer_reviews.title: FOLKS IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE 5'X5' bathroom This is a replacement for one I had previously (Different Brand) That I ran 24/7 for 5 years This is not Quiet I'TS SILENT!!!, The amount of moisture it pulls from the air is Phenomenal I bought the Mid size
customer_reviews.author: c y m

customer_reviews.title: The size is perfect and it is pretty quiet compared to other dehumidifiers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one bedroom in the basement. The size is perfect and it is pretty quiet compared to other dehumidifiers. Moreover, water tank is big enough so that we can operate several days in our basement because our basement is not so humid.
customer_reviews.author: Daewon Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Moisture is history.
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly. I have an area of about 300 sq. ft. that will stay moist, humid where you can see the moisture on the concrete floor. It took approx. 4 days of being on to start drying the area up, but now it is staying dry. No smell of stale air, no wet floors, no slipping, and just an all around good product.
customer_reviews.author: Samepricesameitem

customer_reviews.title: Made a big difference!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but I felt this product warrants one. I have a small bathroom with 5 people taking showers. The mold and mildew was getting so bad I could barely keep up with it. I even had a couple of mushrooms growing in a corner. NO LIE! I bought this dehumidifier and within a week or so everything was under control. No more mildew or mushrooms. I can't believe how much moisture this thing takes out of the air. It takes about a week to get full then shuts off. The noise is no louder than if you had your bathroom fan running full time. It's definitely worth the purchase for a bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: LadyHawkes

customer_reviews.title: Worked, but not powerful enough for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a louvre door closet that had a humidity level over 70%. The Ivation dehumidifier was clearly removing water, but it just wasn't removing enough to lower the humidity. After several days of not seeing a drop in humidity, I went ahead and bought a compressor style dehumidifier, which did the trick for me. This is a nice dehumidifier and I really wanted it to work. If you have a small space that can be isolated, it may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: glaski

customer_reviews.title: working great
customer_reviews.text: it is doing a really good job and we are happy with it so far only had it for a couple weeks so will see Feeling like it is a really good product !!! thanks
customer_reviews.author: A. Crisp

customer_reviews.title: Living in a 40ft. motorhome in Washington State, ...
customer_reviews.text: Living in a 40ft. motorhome in Washington State, this comes in mighty handy. Have two and they are little 'work-horses'. UPDATE: The units are fine...but the power cords get hot and are usually 'done' in about a year. Getting Ivation to send a new one is a bit like pulling teeth. Keep your customer service # on instruction book or move on to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: david mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great little dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: Great little dehumidifier! Probably want something bigger if you are doing more than one room. But for us it worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Mpoulin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t take enough water out of air for us
customer_reviews.text: Great for small spaces but for us it isn’t pulling enough moisture out of the air. We bought three and one makes a horrendous noise when you run it and we haven’t had it that long . It’s very easy to dump and perfect size to tight spaces . But unfortunately does not take enough water out of air for us.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Inconspicious and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these on opposite ends of our basement, which is mostly concrete and built into a hill. So it would stay damp all the time. They work great. They are sleek and fit it the background nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost didn't get. Needed one & kept reading reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: Almost didn't get. Needed one & kept reading reviews where it didn't work for ppl as in collecting water. I would guess the humidity is not high enough for where they are using it. Set mine up at 8pm after opening & next morning around 7a. I checked & had almost 2" of water in the tray. My back room gets lightly moldy walls so hope it eventually helps.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kinard

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use-like just plug it in and turn it ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my RV in the Oregon coast. It is easy to use-like just plug it in and turn it on. It is quiet. In about 36 hours I collected three cups of water. It works better when it is in a closed environment (windows and doors closed) and when the temperature in the room is warmer.
customer_reviews.author: ej

customer_reviews.title: Not so powerful
customer_reviews.text: Live in a 500 sq foot one level apartment and the humidity gets very thick and hot. I purchased the "Ivation IVADM35 Powerful Mid-Size Thermo-Electric Dehumidifier" and I can tell you it does VERY LITTLE to reduce the humidity. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great product, only lasted a year (ran constantly).
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted a year, but worked great in that time so we bought another.
customer_reviews.author: jacie

customer_reviews.title: It does its job as long as you are not ...
customer_reviews.text: It does its job as long as you are not in a fairly humid area. In that case it struggles to keep up. In a small dorm room and cant maintain below 68% humidity. Water receptacle fills up every 3-4 days so it is working. Guess I needed the industrial version?!?
customer_reviews.author: J. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughters dorm room and withing 15 minutes it was collecting water and by the next day you could tell the difference in the feel of the room. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Twin mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little guy!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice much of a difference at first, but I think this little guy is perfect for my apt. I only have to change it out every few days, and I've had less of a bug problem since I got it! My old dehumidifier was huge and noisy, and it had to be changed every few hours - which obviously means it sucked a TON of water out of the air. But this little one is a good compromise! :)
customer_reviews.author: Abby O'Steen

customer_reviews.title: Chillin the Humidity out of a Tropical living environment
customer_reviews.text: Very easy, no assembly required, just plug it in turn it on and the humid conditions in my bedroom and closet changed for the better. Highly recommended I will buy another one for my bathroom. I live in Hawaii a beautiful place for sure but the humidity you can cut with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony R. Kassel

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if it came apart so I could clean it
customer_reviews.text: I have a small Gurin dehumidifier in the bedroom of the 29ft RV that I live in, but it wasn't enough for the trailer, so I bought this Ivation one for the Kitchen area. It runs constantly and pulls a lot of moisture from the air. It would be nice if it came apart so I could clean it.
customer_reviews.author: weldrwomn

customer_reviews.title: It’s very small. To much money for the size
customer_reviews.text: For 89. I would have expected it to be larger. I just keep moving it around the room.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley L. Mathews

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE Transformer Overheating
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have read the reviews all the way through. This noisy piece of junk overheats after just a few hours of use. The transformer is scalding hot to the touch and could have been a major fire hazard if I hadn't checked it. The unit is also incredibly loud for something advertised as "very quiet". Bottom line: save your money and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Reduced humidity by 5% in my 1 bed apartment
customer_reviews.text: Good looking and quiet. I use it in my 900 square foot apartment. It only can reduce the humidity by 5% and I have it running continuously day and night. The humidity in my apartment dropped from 55-60% to now 50-55%. That 5% difference make a big difference! I now can raise the temperature from 70 degrees to 72 degrees saving money on air conditioning and I still feel more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Easy to use, small and compact, easy to move around. Does have a fan noise, I just think of it as white noise and I know it's running. Power brick does get really hot, I only run it during the day, and unplug it at night.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good job for an area of about 800 sq
customer_reviews.text: Quiet. Pretty good job for an area of about 800 sq.ft. Lowers humidity from 90% to around 60%. after 2-3 days. Doubt it could handle much humidity in area any larger. Stopped working after 18 mos but turned out only to be the off switch activated by the float in the reservoir was stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Drying air in motor home
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted! It is quiet and compact while pulling moisture out. I am using it in my 26’ motor home while I stay in it. No more steamy windows or water on the sill to mildew. Yes I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayhurst

customer_reviews.title: Mold in my truck.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smaller model last year and it was dead on arrival. Sent it back, got my refund and forgot about for a year. With El Nino here this winter we have had a lot of rain and my old Ford truck leaked like a sieve. It was sitting for several days when I checked it. The back seat and the floor mats were moldy. Time for the dehumidifier. Ordered the next larger unit, received it in just a few days, set it up in my and it worked great. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Well it's not powerful. I have a finished basement ...
customer_reviews.text: Well it's not powerful. I have a finished basement, and the room is a gym, the room is 300sq ft. It's very humid in the room, you can smell the moisture in the air it's so humid. The dehumidifier just can't handle the job. Need something bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Columbus M Grady Jr

customer_reviews.title: Small enough to hide, big enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.text: Small enough to hide, big enough to do the job. I put it in my bathroom (and turned it on), and by the time I had to actually use the rest room (an hour or so later) it already pulled enough water to layer the bottom of the container. A good buy, hopefully it has a long life span.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus S

customer_reviews.title: Great dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: This quiet, little dehumidifier works wonders in my small, damp bathroom. I have read some complaints in reviews about the transformer (power converter) getting hot while running, but that is what all such things do. It is not a defect. I plan on buying some more for my old house. No complaints from me.
customer_reviews.author: catlynn

customer_reviews.title: Do it
customer_reviews.text: Great little unit! One time when I dumped the reservoir and replaced, the fan got all loud and obnoxious, but a minute of waiting and it was good again. 3 weeks of 24/7 use and it is 100% good to go.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: This is absolutely not worth the money. It collects ...
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely not worth the money. It collects so little water, and this is in a very humid 28 foot travel trailer, you could collect more water with a sponge in 10 minutes than it does in 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: a citizen

customer_reviews.title: so good. We have this in our fifth wheel and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We have this in our fifth wheel and in 24 hours of near constant use I dumped almost one cup of water out. I will know more this weekend when we cook out here and build up the humidity levels again. Update: Has performed far better than expected in our fifth wheel camper. it took seven days to fill up the water tank, and which came out to 1.5 liters. So the machine extracts about 210 ml in 24 hours. I am thinking about getting another one to put in our bedroom because the windows are always moist there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working out for my space
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, I have this unit in our bedroom. It has only accumulated maybe 8 ounces in 4days and I live in south Texas. I have a larger unit in the living room and it works quite well. I will be returning. Pros it is quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am 100% pleased and highly recommend this unit
customer_reviews.text: I have two compressor type dehumidifiers for home use but I needed a smaller unit for the RV. I was sorta reluctant, but I should not have been. I checked it the next day and poured some water out. Yup, at least it is working. I got busy and a week went by, and was I surprised.....the reservoir was full and the unit had shut itself off. Yes, I am 100% pleased and highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: really does the job - powerful small unit
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the performance. Terrific for small areas. Well designed and easy to empty out. Best feature is automatic shut-off when tub is full.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This device really sucks the moisture out of the air.
customer_reviews.author: Kristinnln

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Helps in our motorhome. we get a lot of water inside the windows and this assists in reducing the zmount
customer_reviews.author: Brian Headrick

customer_reviews.title: One week in and we love it! Our new-to-us motorcoach has a musty smell
customer_reviews.text: One week in and we love it! Our new-to-us motorcoach has a musty smell, plus we live in a very rainy, humid climate and the Ivation is working amazingly well. Very quiet, fast acting. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: irisheyes1125

customer_reviews.title: Great Job For Size & Price
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this little dehumidifier!! It is SO much quieter than the previous one we had and does a great job collecting the water in the container. I am very pleased with shipping and performance!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Barton

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but not very powerful. Best for smaller spaces, less humidity.
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact dehumidifier that is very quiet, but not very powerful. I probably expected too much of it, as I wanted it to dehumidify a workout room with 4-8 people exercising and no air flow. It just can't keep up. For a smaller space or less humidity, it might be the perfect little device.
customer_reviews.author: Up North

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job for its size.
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier was delivered promptly in good condition right to my front door. I know that it is supposed to be used in small rooms, but I'm using it in the hallway of my apartment to remove extra moisture. I live in Florida and the air is humid here! The air conditioner removes some of the moisture, but my home is even more comfortable with this little dehumidifier humming along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa Mills

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent DE humidifier mine worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a champion. Do not let the size fool you it works very well had 0 issues with it out the Box worked perfect
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the difference in the amount of time it was taking my wood products to dry from staining before and after receiving this dehumidifier. My room is 12'x16'. I empty the container about every 4 or 5 days. Amazing, how much water is in the air. My wood stain and finish dries as it should now, overnight instead of 2 days!
customer_reviews.author: Pcnative

customer_reviews.title: This item worked great for about 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great for about 5 months, then it broke. It collected a lot of water from my bedroom, but after 5 months of use I noticed a burning smell, and the dehumidifier was off. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: cg

product_meta.title: Ivation IVADM35 Powerful Mid-Size Thermo-Electric Dehumidifier - Quietly Gathers Up to 20 Ounces of Water Per Day - for Bath Room, Basement, Attic, Boats, Rv Ect - for Spaces Up to 2,200 Cubic Feet
product_meta.description: This isn't a watered-down version of a bigger dehumidifier - it's a highly effective mid-size machine in its own right, built around the powerful and whisper-quiet Peltier technology. Because Peltier technology works with no moving parts, we managed to design and develop our dehumidifier as a compact appliance: small, lightweight, low on energy consumption, powerful, effective at drying up musty rooms, and, with all that, a long lifespan. Rated at being suited for spaces up to 2,200 cubic feet, our mid-size dehumidifier is the perfect tool to extract moisture and dust particles from stagnant areas and mildew- and mold-stricken rooms. From bathrooms to laundry rooms to bedrooms to antique cars to boats, it rids the air of mustiness and unpleasant odors while quietly pulling in excess humidity at a rate of up to 20 ounces per day at 86 Degree Fahrenheit and 80% relative humidity. The Ivation mid-size dehumidifier is fitted with a removable water reservoir with a capacity of two full liters. This spares you the hustle of emptying out an overflowing water tank every day, as it can hold approximately 3-days' worth of dehumidifying action. Our dehumidifier is also programmed to shut off automatically once it has reached capacity. An indicator light will go on to remind you to empty the tank out. A 12v DC power adapter is included, and power consumption peaks at 72w, making this an efficient and reliable unit with the comfortable dimensions of 81/2" x 14" x 63/4".
feature_bullets: Thermo-electric Peltier module Technology: Medium in Size, Big on Power with No Moving Parts. Reduces humidity in Closet, Basement, Crawl Space, RV, Boat, Car, Home, Bathroom, Bedroom , Small Areas and Tiny Spaces
Squeezes Up to 20 oz. of Water a Day From Humid Air
Very Quiet Operation Due to No Moving Parts
At Capacity, Indicator Lights Up and Device Shuts Off
Compact at 4.45 pounds, 6.8” x 8.5” x 14” - for Closet, Basement, Crawl Space, RV, Boat, Car, Home, Bathroom, Bedroom , Small Areas and Tiny Spaces.
